definitions.definition: A formalized choice on matters of administration or other democratic activities
definitions.example: One occasion indicative votes were used was in 2003 when MPs were presented with seven different options on how to reform the House of Lords.

definitions.definition: An act or instance of participating in such a choice, e.g., by submitting a ballot
definitions.example: The Supreme Court upheld the principle of one person, one vote.

definitions.definition: An ardent wish or desire; a vow; a prayer
To cast a vote; to assert a formalized choice in an election
To choose or grant by means of a vote, or by general consent
definitions.example: The depository may vote shares on behalf of investors who have not submitted instruction to the bank.
